page.title: 07A local shopkeeper
page.content: Mr Hardie is a shopkeeper and he has stayed at Springholm for 5.5 years. He is selling the shop because he wants to retire. The rates have gone up from Â£245 to Â£600 in one year. There is a lot of traffic going through Springholm. If Mr Hardie was not a shopkeeper he would like to be a farmer. He has no complaints about Springholm. Mr Hardie had been at Springholm on holiday and liked it so he moved here. He would like to retire to one of the villages around here but would not like to live in a city. Mr Hardie says that the drivers do not stick to the 40 mile limit and the reason it is not reduced is because there are houses only on one side of the road. He thinks there should be a new rating system but he does not know how they're going to do it. He thought it was a good life.
